Package control

Class ExampleLeg

java.lang.Object
control.SpiderLeg
control.ExampleLeg
public abstract class ExampleLeg
extends SpiderLeg
ExampleLeg acts as a basic implementation of SpiderLeg. The workflow for how legs work is as follows. 1. Urls from getStartPages() are added to the queue. 2. First page page from queue is sent to handlePage(String url). 3. Any desired urls from handlePage should be added to pagesToAdd. 4. Urls from getLinks() are added to the queue. 5. Repeat from step 2 until the queue is empty. 6. conclude() is called. The workflow is handled in Spider, leg just needs to implement these methods. This class has all aspects implemented to some degree, with the exception of Looking at the contents of a web page and determining which links from it to add to pagesToAdd. --> Implement pullUrls(String html) for that functionality.

    • handlePage

      public boolean handlePage​(java.lang.String url)
      This method does anything the crawler needs to do on any particular web page. getLinks is called after this method, so any urls to add should be added to pagesToAdd during this method's execution.
      Specified by:
      handlePage in class SpiderLeg
      Parameters:
      url - The url of the web page.
      Returns:
      Whether the web page was successfully handled.
